means: Rhodesian Independence Gung-Ho Troops 罗德西亚独立同心团

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"准确的，正确的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: accurate, exact, precise, right, true, correct
means: accurate ：指通过谨慎的努力达到符合事实或实际，侧重不同程度的准确性，与事实无出入。
exact ：着重在质与量方面的准确，语气比accurate强。
precise ：侧重极端准确，更强调细节的精确无误。
right ：使用广泛，可与这些词中的correct换用，但常暗示道德、理解、行动等方面的正确。
true ：暗指绝对准确，尤指复制品与原件丝毫不差。
correct ：最常用词，主要指按一定标准或规则来衡量，没有谬误和差错或无缺点错误。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均含"权利"之意。
means: right ： 普通用词，指某人或某物拥有符合法律、道义或道德的权利。
privilege ： 指特许或恩施的权利，也指一般人或物所没有的有利条件。

word_mean: right-angle connector 连接器的电缆引出端的轴线与插合面的轴线成直角的连接器。

sentence.Network_en: Instead of complaining about what's wrong, be grateful for what's right.
sentence.Network_cn: 别抱怨不好的事，要对好的事心存感恩。

sentence.Network_en: You'll need to get on the right side of Carmela.
More people would be attracted to cycling if conditions were right.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果天气适宜，会有更多的人被吸引到骑自行车的行列中来。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 权利斗争的目的不是取得权力(Power)，而是取得权利(Right)。权利虽然也包括政治权力的内容，但它主要是扩大政治参与、提高政治 …
Hjust ：选择文字与元件的水平距离，可以是缺省位置的偏左(Left)、居中 (Center)、偏右(Right)。  Vjust：选择文字与元件的垂直距 …
词汇竞赛 - 中国习网 ... light 光 Right 右边 wrong 错误.
字典中得字的解释 ... 必须,应该[ must] 合适;正确[ suitable;right] ◎ 得 de.

list.abs: 数学英语词汇大全_百度文库 ... 锐角 acute angle 直角 right angle 钝角 obtuse angle.
大学英语四级常用词组 ... be aware of 知道，意识到，认识到 right away 立刻，马上 back and forth (前后)来回地，往返.
初中英语短语大全 ... 46．drive away (汽车)离开 47．right away 立刻 48．right now 此刻，刚才，现在.
四年级上册英语单词_百度文库 ... clean 打扫，清洁，擦干净的 all right 好吧， you 你.
初中英语短语大全 ... 47．right away 立刻 48．right now 此刻，刚才，现在 51．leave the hospital 离开医院.

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a criminal) with positive proof of guilt
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（罪犯）犯罪证据确凿，无可抵赖

lj.lj_ly: we've got you bang to rights handling stolen property.
lj.lj_ls: 我们有确凿证据你收赃。

jx.jx_en_mean: be morally or legally justified in one's views, actions, or decisions
jx.jx_cn_mean: （观点、行为或决定）正当，正确，有理

jx.jx_en_mean: as a result of one's own claims, qualifications, or efforts, rather than an association with someone else
jx.jx_cn_mean: 凭自身的权利（或资格、努力）而非凭借与他人的关系

lj.lj_ly: he was already established as a poet in his own right.
lj.lj_ls: 他早已凭自身的努力成为一位诗人。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 神智（不）健全的，（不）理智的
(非正式)（人）神智不太健全的，不太理智的

jx.jx_en_mean: as a result of having a moral or legal claim or entitlement
jx.jx_cn_mean: 属正当（或合法）要求，依正当（或合法）权利

lj.lj_ly: the state will be obliged to provide health care and education as of right.
lj.lj_ls: 国家有义务提供属正当权利的医疗保健和教育。

jx.jx_en_mean: the necessary qualities for a given task or job
jx.jx_cn_mean: （完成特定工作、任务的）必要品质

lj.lj_ly: he had the right stuff to enter this business.
lj.lj_ls: 他具备进入这家企业的必备素质。

jx.jx_en_mean: make someone understand the true facts of a situation
restore something to its correct or normal state or condition
(informal)(of a person) feeling completely well or healthy, typically after an illness or minor accident
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（人）（尤指病后或小事故后）完全健康

phrase.cizu_name: right (或 straight) away ( 或 非正式

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used as an expression of strong support, approval, or encouragement
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)好哇，行啊（表示坚决支持、同意或鼓励）。 参见right-on

means.word_mean: 对的;正当的,正义的;适当的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English riht (adjective and noun), rihtan (verb), rihte (adverb), of Germanic origin; related to Latin rectus 'ruled', from an Indo-European root denoting movement in a straight line

collins.tran: 正确的;适当的;可接受的

entry.tran: 对的;正确的;符合事实的
entry.def: If something is right, it is correct and agrees with the facts.

example.ex: That's absolutely right...
example.tran: 那绝对正确。

example.ex: Clocks never told the right time...
example.tran: 钟表显示的时间从来都不准确。

entry.def: If you do something in the right way or in the right place, you do it as or where it should be done or was planned to be done.

example.ex: Walking, done in the right way, is a form of aerobic exercise...
example.tran: 走路，如果方法正确的话，也是一种有氧健身运动。

example.ex: They have computerized systems to ensure delivery of the right pizza to the right place...
example.tran: 他们已经实现了系统的计算机化，以保证比萨的送货准确无误。

entry.tran: (地方)为大众接受的;(人)正派的，体面的
entry.def: If you say that someone is seen in all the right places or knows all the right people, you mean that they go to places which are socially acceptable or know people who are socially acceptable.

example.ex: He was always to be seen in the right places...
example.tran: 他总是会出现在一些体面的地方。

example.ex: Through his father, he had met all the right people.
example.tran: 他通过父亲认识了很多正派的人。

entry.def: If someone is right about something, they are correct in what they say or think about it.

example.ex: Ron has been right about the result of every General Election but one...
example.tran: 罗恩对于历届大选结果都预测对了，只有一次除外。

example.ex: Is that true? Was she right?...
example.tran: 那是真的吗？她说得没错吗？

entry.tran: (选择、行动、决定等)正确的，最好的，最合适的
entry.def: If something such as a choice, action, or decision is the right one, it is the best or most suitable one.

example.ex: She'd made the right choice in leaving New York...
example.tran: 她离开纽约的决定是正确的。

example.ex: The right decision was made, but probably for the wrong reasons...
example.tran: 作出的决定是正确的，但理由可能是错误的。

entry.tran: 正常的;没有问题的;令人满意的
entry.def: If something is not right, there is something unsatisfactory about the situation or thing that you are talking about.

example.ex: Ratatouille doesn't taste right with any other oil...
example.tran: 普罗旺斯杂烩用其他任何油炒出来的味道都不正宗。

example.ex: The name Sue Anne never seemed quite right to Molly...
example.tran: 莫莉总觉得休·安妮这个名字不太好听。

entry.tran: 对的;正当的;有理的;合乎道德的
entry.def: If you think that someone was right to do something, you think that there were good moral reasons why they did it.

example.ex: You were right to do what you did, under the circumstances...
example.tran: 在这种情况下，你做的是对的。

example.ex: The president was absolutely right in ordering the bombing raid.
example.tran: 总统下令发动空袭是绝对合乎道义的。

entry.tran: (活动或行动)符合道德的，正当的
entry.def: Right is used to refer to activities or actions that are considered to be morally good and acceptable.

example.ex: It's not right, leaving her like this...
example.tran: 就这样离开她是不对的。

example.ex: Fox hunting is popular among some people in this country. It doesn't make it right though...
example.tran: 这个国家有些人喜欢猎狐，但是这并不能使其变得名正言顺。

entry.def: If you right something or if it rights itself, it returns to its normal or correct state, after being in an undesirable state.

example.ex: They recognise the urgency of righting the economy...
example.tran: 他们认识到了复苏经济的紧迫性。

example.ex: Your eyesight rights itself very quickly.
example.tran: 你的视力恢复得非常快。

entry.def: If you right a wrong, you do something to make up for a mistake or something bad that you did in the past.

example.ex: We've made progress in righting the wrongs of the past...
example.tran: 我们在纠正过去的错误方面取得了进展。

example.ex: Having spent 25 years righting his own mistakes, he is anxious that children should not waste opportunities.
example.tran: 他花了25年的时间弥补自己的过失，因此他非常渴望孩子们不要错失良机。

entry.def: If you right something that has fallen or rolled over, or if it rights itself, it returns to its normal upright position.

example.ex: He righted the yacht and continued the race...
example.tran: 他调正了快艇，继续比赛。

example.ex: The helicopter turned at an awful angle before righting itself.
example.tran: 直升机在恢复平稳之前倾斜得很厉害。

entry.def: The right side of a material is the side that is intended to be seen and that faces outwards when it is made into something.
If you say that things are going right, you mean that your life or a situation is developing as you intended or expected and you are pleased with it.

example.ex: I can't think of anything in my life that's going right...
example.tran: 我想不起我的生活中有任何一帆风顺的事情。

example.ex: I was pleased with my performance on Saturday — everything went right.
example.tran: 我对自己星期六的表现挺满意——一切顺利。

entry.tran: (道德上或法律上)有理的，合理的，正确的，说得通的
entry.def: If someone has behaved in a way which is morally or legally right, you can say that they are in the right. You usually use this expression when the person is involved in an argument or dispute.

example.ex: She wasn't entirely in the right...
example.tran: 她并非完全占理。

example.ex: Legally, the local tax office is in the right.
example.tran: 从法律的角度来说，当地税务局的做法是无可厚非的。

entry.def: If you put something right, you correct something that was wrong or that was causing problems.

example.ex: We've discovered what's gone wrong and are going to put it right.
example.tran: 我们已经发现了存在的问题，准备加以纠正。

entry.tran: 白马王子;梦中情人;理想的伴侣
entry.def: You can use Mr Right ,Miss Right, or Ms Right to talk about the kind of person that you imagine you will marry or spend the rest of your life with.

example.ex: She confesses to having trouble finding Mr Right.
example.tran: 她承认找不到自己的白马王子。

example.ex: ...bachelors searching for Ms Right.
example.tran: 寻找真命天女的单身汉们

entry.def: The right is one of two opposite directions, sides, or positions. If you are facing north and you turn to the right, you will be facing east. In the word 'to', the 'o' is to the right of the 't'.

example.ex: Ahead of you on the right will be a lovely garden...
example.tran: 在你右前方会有一个美丽的花园。

example.ex: He looks to his left, up at the screen, then to his right.
example.tran: 他朝左边看了看，抬头望向屏幕，然后又看了看右边。

entry.def: Your right arm, leg, or ear, for example, is the one which is on the right side of your body. Your right shoe or glove is the one which is intended to be worn on your right foot or hand.
You can refer to people who support the political ideals of capitalism and conservatism as the right. They are often contrasted with the left, who support the political ideals of socialism.

example.ex: The Tory Right despise him...
example.tran: 保守党右翼分子鄙视他。

example.ex: The right attacks me for being irreligious.
example.tran: 右翼分子抨击我没有宗教信仰。

entry.def: If you say that someone has moved to the right, you mean that their political beliefs have become more right-wing.

example.ex: They see the shift to the right as a worldwide phenomenon.
example.tran: 他们认为政治上的右翼倾向是一个世界现象。

entry.tran: 是…的得力助手;是…的左膀右臂
entry.def: If someone is at a person's right hand, they work closely with that person so they can help and advise them.

example.ex: I think he ought to be at the right hand of the president.
example.tran: 我想他应该成为总统的得力助手。

entry.def: Your rights are what you are morally or legally entitled to do or to have.

example.ex: They don't know their rights...
example.tran: 他们不知道自己的权利。

example.ex: You must stand up for your rights.
example.tran: 你必须维护自己的权利。

entry.def: If you have a right to do or to have something, you are morally or legally entitled to do it or to have it.

example.ex: ...a woman's right to choose...
example.tran: 女性的选择权

example.ex: People have the right to read any kind of material they wish.
example.tran: 人们有权利阅读自己喜欢的任何东西。

entry.def: If someone has the rights to a story or book, they are legally allowed to publish it or reproduce it in another form, and nobody else can do so without their permission.

example.ex: An agent bought the rights to his life...
example.tran: 一个经纪人购买了他的传记的出版权。

example.ex: He'd tried to buy the film rights of all George Bernard Shaw's plays.
example.tran: 他曾尝试买下萧伯纳所有戏剧的电影改编权。

entry.def: If something is not the case but you think that it should be, you can say that by rights it should be the case.

example.ex: She did work which by rights should be done by someone else.
example.tran: 她做了理应由别人做的事情。

entry.tran: 靠自己努力;凭借自身才能
entry.def: If someone is a successful or respected person in their own right, they are successful or respected because of their own efforts and talents rather than those of the people they are closely connected with.

example.ex: Although now a celebrity in her own right, actress Lynn Redgrave knows the difficulties of living in the shadow of her famous older sister...
example.tran: 虽然女演员琳恩·雷德格雷夫现在依靠自己的能力出了名，但她明白生活在大名鼎鼎的姐姐的阴影里有多不容易。

example.ex: Their baby is a person in his own right.
example.tran: 他们的宝宝是个很独立的人。

entry.def: If you say that you reserve the right to do something, you mean that you will do it if you feel that it is necessary.

example.ex: He reserved the right to change his mind...
example.tran: 他保留了改变主意的权利。

example.ex: The ministry said it reserved the right to take whatever action necessary.
example.tran: 该部表示保留采取任何必要行动的权利。

entry.def: If you say that someone is within their rights to do something, you mean that they are morally or legally entitled to do it.

example.ex: You were quite within your rights to refuse to co-operate with him.
example.tran: 你完全有权拒绝跟他合作。

entry.tran: (用于引起注意或表示已经完成一件事情，接下来可以开始另一件事情)好的，对
entry.def: You use right in order to attract someone's attention or to indicate that you have dealt with one thing so you can go on to another.

example.ex: Right, I'll be back in a minute...
example.tran: 好的，我一会儿就回来。

example.ex: Wonderful. Right, let's go to our next caller.
example.tran: 太棒了。好的，我们接听下一个电话。

entry.tran: （用于确认所说的话是否正确）对吗，是吗，对吧
entry.def: You can use right to check whether what you have just said is correct.

example.ex: They have a small plane, right?
example.tran: 他们有一架小飞机，对吧？

example.ex: So if it's not there now, the killer has it. Right?
example.tran: 如果它现在不在那里，就在凶手那里。是吧？

entry.tran: (用于表示倾听某人的话并表示接受或理解)嗯，对，是
entry.def: You can say 'right' to show that you are listening to what someone is saying and that you accept it or understand it.

example.ex: 'Your children may well come away speaking with a bit of a broad country accent' — 'Right.' — 'because they're mixing with country children.'
example.tran: “你的孩子们走的时候可能会带点儿浓重的乡下口音。”——“嗯。”——“因为他们现在和乡下孩子打成一片。”

entry.def: You say 'right on' to express your support or approval.

example.ex: He suggested that many of the ideas just would not work. But the tenor of his input was 'Right on! Please show us how to make them work'.
example.tran: 他认为这些想法有很多根本就不会奏效。但是他说话的大意却是“好极了！请告诉我们怎么让它们见效”。

entry.def: If someone says 'right you are', they are agreeing to do something in a very willing and happy way.

example.ex: 'I want a word with you when you stop.' — 'Right you are.'
example.tran: “等你停下来的时候，我想跟你说句话。”——“好的。”

entry.tran: (地方、位置或时间)准确地，恰当地，精确地
entry.def: You can use right to emphasize the precise place, position, or time of something.

example.ex: The back of a car appeared right in front of him.
example.tran: 汽车尾部正对着他。

example.ex: ...a charming resort right on the Italian frontier...
example.tran: 就在意大利边境上的一个美丽的度假胜地

entry.def: You can use right to emphasize how far something moves or extends or how long it continues.

example.ex: ...the highway that runs through the Indian zone right to the army positions...
example.tran: 穿过印第安人居住区直达军队阵地的公路

example.ex: She was kept very busy right up to the moment of her departure...
example.tran: 她一直忙得不可开交，直到出发的那一刻还在忙。

entry.def: You can use right to emphasize that an action or state is complete.

example.ex: The candle had burned right down...
example.tran: 这根蜡烛完全烧尽了。

example.ex: The handle came right off in my hand.
example.tran: 把手一下子就从我的手中脱落。

entry.tran: 完全的;彻头彻尾的;严重的
entry.def: You can use right to emphasize a noun, usually a noun referring to something bad.

example.ex: He gave them a right telling off...
example.tran: 他狠狠地责备了他们一通。

example.ex: England's European Championship plans are in a right mess.
example.tran: 英格兰队的欧洲锦标赛作战计划乱七八糟。

entry.def: If you say that something happened right after a particular time or event or right before it, you mean that it happened immediately after or before it.

example.ex: All of a sudden, right after the summer, Mother gets married...
example.tran: 突然，刚过夏天，妈妈就结婚了。

example.ex: She then decided right before the opening to make a dramatic announcement.
example.tran: 然后就在开幕式开始之前，她决定要宣布一件激动人心的事情。

entry.tran: 我马上就到/我马上回来
entry.def: If you say I'll be right there or I'll be right back, you mean that you will get to a place or get back to it in a very short time.

example.ex: I'm going to get some water. I'll be right back.
example.tran: 我去拿点水。马上就回来。

entry.def: If you do something right away or right off, you do it immediately.

example.ex: He wants to see you right away...
example.tran: 他想马上见你。

example.ex: I knew right away she was dead...
example.tran: 我马上就知道她死了。

entry.def: You can use right now to emphasize that you are referring to the present moment.

example.ex: Right now I'm feeling very excited...
example.tran: 现在，我觉得非常激动。

example.ex: I'm warning you; stop it right now!
example.tran: 我警告你，马上住手！

entry.tran: （用于英国的某些尊称中，表示级别或地位高）
entry.def: Right is used in some British titles. It indicates high rank or status.

example.ex: ...The Right Reverend John Baker.
example.tran: 约翰·贝克牧师阁下

example.ex: ...the Right Honourable Lynn Jones MP.
example.tran: 尊敬的林恩·琼斯议员阁下

means.word_mean: 1. an abstract idea of that which is due to a person or governmental body by law or tradition or nature;

sentences.sentence: "they are endowed by their Creator with certain unalienable Rights"
"Certain rights can never be granted to the government but must be kept in the hands of the people"- Eleanor Roosevelt
"a right is not something that somebody gives you; it is something that nobody can take away"

means.word_mean: 2. (frequently plural) the interest possessed by law or custom in some intangible thing;
3. location near or direction toward the right side; i.e. the side to the south when a person or object faces east;
5. those who support political or social or economic conservatism; those who believe that things are better left unchanged
6. anything in accord with principles of justice;

sentences.sentence: "he feels he is in the right"

means.word_mean: 7. the hand that is on the right side of the body;

sentences.sentence: "he writes with his right hand but pitches with his left"
"hit him with quick rights to the body"

means.word_mean: 8. the piece of ground in the outfield on the catcher's right

sentences.sentence: "right a wrongs done to the victims of the Holocaust"

means.word_mean: 2. put in or restore to an upright position;

sentences.sentence: "They righted the sailboat that had capsized"

means.word_mean: 3. regain an upright or proper position;
1. free from error; especially conforming to fact or truth;
2. being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north;

sentences.sentence: "the right bank of a river is the bank on your right side when you are facing downstream"
"it isn't right to leave the party without saying goodbye"

means.word_mean: 4. in conformance with justice or law or morality;
6. appropriate for a condition or occasion;

sentences.sentence: "she is not suitable for the position"

means.word_mean: 7. of or belonging to the political or intellectual right
8. in or into a satisfactory condition;
10. in accord with accepted standards of usage or procedure;
11. having the axis perpendicular to the base;
12. of the side of cloth or clothing intended to face outward;

sentences.sentence: "the right side of the cloth showed the pattern"
"be sure your shirt is right side out"

means.word_mean: 13. most suitable or right for a particular purpose;

sentences.sentence: "the time is ripe for great sociological changes"

means.word_mean: 4. toward or on the right; also used figuratively;
9. in accordance with moral or social standards;

list.explanation: 遵守规矩，有道德，循规蹈矩，为人正常, 诚实可靠

example.en: You must fly right when you get to the party.
example.zh: 你们去参加宴会时，一定要有规矩，要讲礼貌。

example.en: He's my son.I want him to fly right.
example.zh: 他是我儿子。我希望他做人能正直。

example.en: Do-right boys patrol day and night guarding the highway.
example.zh: 警察日夜巡逻保卫这条公路。

list.explanation: (对人或物表示满意或赞美)不错，相当好(尤指漂亮或吸引人的女性)

example.en: A: " What's she like?" B: "The girl? Bit of all right，from her pictures
example.zh: 甲:"她长得怎么样？" 乙:"那姑娘？从照片上看真不错。"

auth_sentence.content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content: He would run right across the pitch with it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He would run right across the pitch with it.

auth_sentence.content: Corner taken by Joe Cole from the right by-line.
auth_sentence.res_content: Corner taken by Joe Cole from the right by-line.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Corner taken by Joe Cole from the right by-line.

auth_sentence.content: His usurping dynasty had no right to the crown.
auth_sentence.res_content: His usurping dynasty had no right to the crown.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His usurping dynasty had no right to the crown.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 刚硬的, 刚性的, 严格的
stems_affixes.word_buile: rig正,直+id如……的→直的→刚硬的, 刚性的→严格的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 正义[的,地], 公正[的,地], 正确[的,地]
stems_affixes.word_buile: rig正,直+ht→adj.&adv.&n.正义[的,地], 公正[的,地], 正确[的,地]

stems_affixes.value_cn: 垂直的, 竖式的, 正直的
stems_affixes.word_buile: up向上+right[adj.&adv.&n.正义[的,地], 公正[的,地], 正确[的,地]]→adj.&adv.&n.垂直的, 竖式的, 正直的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 端正地, 正当地, 正确地
stems_affixes.word_buile: right[adj.&adv.&n.正义[的,地], 公正[的,地], 正确[的,地]]+ly表副词→adv. 端正地, 正当地, 正确地

stems_affixes.value_cn: 严格, 严厉, 苛刻, 严密, 严酷, 精确
stems_affixes.word_buile: rig正,直+or表名词→严格, 严厉

means.word_mean: 正当的, 适当的, 合法的, 符合要求的

sentences.en: I'll try to do whatever is right.
sentences.cn: 只要是正当的事, 我都尽力去做。

means.word_mean: 对的, 正确的, 准确的

sentences.en: He gave the right answer.
sentences.cn: 他做出了正确的回答。

sentences.en: Actually, that's not quite right.
sentences.cn: 实际上, 那不完全对。

sentences.en: It was right that I should be present.
sentences.cn: 我自然应当到场。

sentences.en: Take a right turn at the crossroads.
sentences.cn: 在十字路口右转弯。

means.word_mean: 切合实际的, 最适宜的, 最恰当的

sentences.en: She's the sort of woman who always says the right things.
sentences.cn: 她是一个说话总能恰到好处的女人。

sentences.en: Their ages were just right for a match.
sentences.cn: 他俩的年龄结婚匹配正相宜。

sentences.en: Things are right now again.
sentences.cn: 事情又恢复正常了。

sentences.en: That man's a right idiot!
sentences.cn: 那个男子完全是个白痴。

sentences.en: Go right home at once, don't stop off anywhere on the way.
sentences.cn: 直接回家去, 别在路上的什么地方呆下来。

sentences.en: I'm right behind you there.
sentences.cn: 我完全支持你。

sentences.en: Turn right at the end of the street.
sentences.cn: 在这条街的尽头向右拐。

means.word_mean: 正确地; 令人满意地; 恰当地

sentences.en: Have I guessed right or wrong?
sentences.cn: 我猜得对不对?

sentences.en: Nothing seems to be going right for me at the moment.
sentences.cn: 我现在好像事事不顺心。

sentences.en: I'll go right after lunch.
sentences.cn: 午饭后我马上去。

means.word_mean: 正确; 正当; 公正; 正义

sentences.en: You're old enough to know the difference between right and wrong.
sentences.cn: 你已经长大了, 能够分辨是非了。

sentences.en: We fought for the right of access to government information.
sentences.cn: 我们争取查看政府资料的权利。

sentences.en: Tony was sitting on my right.
sentences.cn: 托尼坐在我的右边。

sentences.en: He got me with a right to the jaw.
sentences.cn: 他用右手朝我下巴打了一拳。

means.word_mean: 使回复到适当的[正确的, 直立的]位置

sentences.en: The inventory situation was righting itself.
sentences.cn: 库存局面正在恢复正常。

sentences.en: The mistake is being righted.
sentences.cn: 错误正在得到纠正。

sentences.en: We should right the poor and the oppressed.
sentences.cn: 我们应当公正对待穷人和受压迫的人民。

sentences.en: The wronged persons had been righted.
sentences.cn: 受到冤枉的人们都得到了平反。

sentences.en: Our boat righted again after the big wave had passed.
sentences.cn: 我们的船在巨浪过后又逐渐恢复平稳了。

jushi.english: In Britain we drive on the left side of the road, not the right side.
jushi.chinese: 在英国,车辆是靠路的左侧行驶而不是靠右侧行驶。

jushi.english: Are we on the right way?
